definition: to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out

sentences.english: Is there someone you could talk about your fears with, or to go to when someone is being violent?
sentences.chinese: 有人施暴事，是否有人可以讓你談論你的恐懼？

sentences.english: She said she encountered one of the attackers a day before the incident.
sentences.chinese: 她說她在遇襲前一天曾經遇見過其中一個施暴者。

sentences.english: But are children aware that an abuser may be female?
sentences.chinese: 但孩子們能否意識到施暴者可能是女性呢？

sentences.english: But I was never cruel to Pluto .
sentences.chinese: 但我從不對普路託施暴。

sentences.english: Security must obtain and report as much information possible about the perpetrator.
sentences.chinese: 安全部門須儘可能多地獲得作施暴者的信息。

sentences.english: Lot offers his daughters to a mob of angel rapers.
sentences.chinese: 呼德把他的女兒們提供給一夥要對天使施暴的歹民。

sentences.english: The gang members are playing a cat-and mouse game.
sentences.chinese: 幫派人員在玩弄鬥智施暴的玩藝兒。

sentences.english: We all have the terrorists' indiscriminate violence against ordinary people.
sentences.chinese: 我們憎恨恐怖分子對普通人不加區別的施暴行爲。

sentences.english: Both the KMT and DPP accused each other of public violence and demanded apologies.
sentences.chinese: 藍綠都互控對方公然施暴並要求道歉。

definition: to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to torment/to abuse (an animal, child etc)
violent crime/to commit a violent act (assault or murder)
domestic violence/abbr. for 家庭暴力[jia1 ting2 bao4 li4]
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
